intro: Diapedium pectinatum var. parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered diapedium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, giving it a delicate appearance. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with a fine, waxy coating. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forests or along stream banks.
